title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Nehemiah chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Nehemiah Chapter 11.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11:1, how were people chosen to dwell in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:1 states that the rest of the people cast lots to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who blessed the men that willingly offered to live in Jerusalem according to Nehemiah 11:2?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:2 says the people blessed all the men who willingly offered themselves to dwell at Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11:3, which groups dwelt in the cities of Judah?
options: Israel, the priests, the Levites, the Nethinims, and children of Solomon's servants
questions.correctAnswer: Israel, the priests, the Levites, the Nethinims, and children of Solomon's servants
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:3 lists these groups as dwelling in the cities of Judah.

questions.question: Who was the ruler of the house of God as mentioned in Nehemiah 11:11?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:11 identifies Seraiah son of Hilkiah as the ruler of the house of God.

questions.question: How many Levites were in the holy city according to Nehemiah 11:18?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:18 states there were two hundred fourscore and four Levites in the holy city.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah 11:21 says the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:21 clearly states that the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel.

questions.question: Who was the overseer of the Levites at Jerusalem according to Nehemiah 11:22?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:22 names Uzzi son of Bani as the overseer of the Levites at Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11:23, what was commanded by the king concerning the singers?
options: A certain portion was due for every day
They should fast every other day
They were to perform only on festivals
They should share duties with the priests
questions.correctAnswer: A certain portion was due for every day
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:23 says it was the king's commandment that a certain portion should be for the singers daily.

questions.question: Who was at the king's hand in all matters concerning the people as stated in Nehemiah 11:24?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:24 identifies Pethahiah son of Meshezabeel as the one at the king's hand in all matters.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah 11:9 says Joel was the first overseer of the city, with Judah second.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:9 confirms Joel was the overseer and Judah was second over the city.

questions.question: Where did the rulers of the people dwell according to Nehemiah 11:1?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:1 states the rulers of the people dwelt at Jerusalem.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Nehemiah 11:6, all the sons of Perez that dwelt at Jerusalem were ______ valiant men.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:6 states there were four hundred threescore and eight valiant men of the sons of Perez at Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11:19, how many porters kept the gates?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:19 says the porters and their brethren that kept the gates were one hundred seventy and two.

questions.question: True or False: Nehemiah 11:20 says the priests and Levites dwelt only in Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:20 states that the residue of Israel, priests, and Levites were in all the cities of Judah, not only Jerusalem.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11:15, who was one of the Levites mentioned?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:15 names Shemaiah son of Hashub as one of the Levites.

medium.title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Nehemiah Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 11 teach us about the importance of willingness and commitment in serving God and the community?
options: People willingly offered themselves to dwell in Jerusalem and were blessed for it
People were forced to live in Jerusalem by the rulers
Only priests were allowed to live in Jerusalem
People were indifferent about where they lived
questions.correctAnswer: People willingly offered themselves to dwell in Jerusalem and were blessed for it
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:2 states that the people blessed all the men who willingly offered themselves to dwell at Jerusalem, showing the value of willing commitment. This reflects the biblical virtues of obedience, willingness to serve, and community unity (Nehemiah 11:1, 11:2, 11:20).

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with maintaining integrity and honesty in their work. Based on Nehemiah 11, what truth can you share about faithful service?
options: Faithful service to God includes diligent work in all assigned roles, such as priests, Levites, and porters
Only spiritual leaders need to be honest; others can be lax
Work is irrelevant to spiritual life
People should focus on their own gain, not community service
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful service to God includes diligent work in all assigned roles, such as priests, Levites, and porters
questions.explanation: The chapter lists various groups like priests (11:10-11), Levites (11:15-18), and porters (11:19) diligently performing their duties, teaching us that honesty and integrity matter in all forms of service (Nehemiah 11:10-19).

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11, how does the distribution of people living in Jerusalem versus other cities teach us about stewardship and community support?
options: One out of every ten people lived in Jerusalem to support the holy city, while nine lived in other cities
Everyone was required to live in Jerusalem
Only priests and Levites lived in Jerusalem
People ignored community needs and scattered randomly
questions.correctAnswer: One out of every ten people lived in Jerusalem to support the holy city, while nine lived in other cities
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:1 explains the casting of lots to bring one in ten to dwell in Jerusalem, showing a model of balanced stewardship between the holy city and surrounding towns, encouraging support and care for both spiritual and practical needs (Nehemiah 11:1, 11:20, 11:30).

questions.question: How does the leadership structure described in Nehemiah 11 encourage humility and order in the church community?
options: There were overseers and chiefs for different groups, showing organized and humble service
There was only one leader controlling everything
Leadership was based on wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: There were overseers and chiefs for different groups, showing organized and humble service
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:9, 11:14, and 11:22 show various overseers and leaders responsible for different groups, illustrating humility in service and order in church life by appointing capable men to serve others (Nehemiah 11:9, 11:14, 11:22).

questions.question: What does Nehemiah 11 teach about perseverance through trials when rebuilding spiritual life and community?
options: The people willingly settled in Jerusalem despite challenges, showing perseverance
People gave up easily because the city was tough to live in
Only priests were involved in rebuilding efforts
The people ignored the spiritual restoration
questions.correctAnswer: The people willingly settled in Jerusalem despite challenges, showing perseverance
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:2 and 11:6 describe the people willingly moving to Jerusalem and valiant men dwelling there, indicating perseverance in restoring the spiritual center despite hardships (Nehemiah 11:2, 11:6, 11:20).

questions.question: How does this chapter illustrate the role of prayer and thanksgiving in personal and corporate devotion?
options: Mattaniah led the thanksgiving in prayer, showing the importance of organized worship
Prayer was discouraged in the city
questions.correctAnswer: Mattaniah led the thanksgiving in prayer, showing the importance of organized worship
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:17 highlights Mattaniah as the principal to begin thanksgiving in prayer, emphasizing structured corporate worship and prayer as key to spiritual discipline (Nehemiah 11:15-18, 11:22).

questions.question: True or False: According to Nehemiah 11, the Nethinims had their own overseers and a designated place to dwell.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:21 states that the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel, and Ziha and Gispa were over them, indicating assigned leadership and dwelling, reinforcing order and care within the community.

questions.question: True or False: The singers in the house of God received a daily portion by the king's command as described in Nehemiah 11.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:23 explains that the king had commanded a portion daily for the singers, showing provision for those who serve in worship and the importance of supporting church workers.

questions.question: In Nehemiah 11, which of the following best illustrates the biblical virtue of gratitude and contentment in family and community life?
options: Families and clans living in their own cities and possessions, content with their inheritance
Everyone competing aggressively for land in Jerusalem
People abandoning their homes for wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Families and clans living in their own cities and possessions, content with their inheritance
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:3 and 11:20 describe people dwelling in their possessions and cities, showing contentment and gratitude for God's provision, encouraging faithful stewardship and family stability (Nehemiah 11:3, 11:20).

questions.question: How does the detailed listing of families and their roles in Nehemiah 11 encourage us to appreciate the value of every member's contribution in the church?
options: Each family and group had specific roles, showing that all contributions are important
Only priests mattered in the community
Some families were excluded from service
Roles were assigned randomly without regard to ability
questions.correctAnswer: Each family and group had specific roles, showing that all contributions are important
questions.explanation: The chapter lists priests, Levites, porters, singers, and Nethinims with their duties (Nehemiah 11:10-23), emphasizing that every member’s service is valuable for the whole community’s health and worship.

questions.question: A believer wants to understand how to live with humility and serve others. What example does Nehemiah 11 offer?
options: Leaders and overseers served in assigned roles humbly over the people
questions.correctAnswer: Leaders and overseers served in assigned roles humbly over the people
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:9, 11:14, and 11:22 describe overseers and rulers appointed to serve the community, teaching humility and servant leadership as biblical virtues.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 11 teach us about the importance of organized church life and fellowship?
options: The Levites and priests had divisions and assigned cities to maintain order and fellowship
There was no leadership or structure
questions.correctAnswer: The Levites and priests had divisions and assigned cities to maintain order and fellowship
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:36 and 11:20 explain that Levites and priests lived in their assigned cities and divisions, fostering orderly fellowship and community support within the church.

questions.question: Which passage in Nehemiah 11 encourages believers to trust in God's provision and be content with their inheritance?
options: People dwelling in their own cities and possessions in Judah
People demanding more land from others
People neglecting their homes to seek wealth
questions.correctAnswer: People dwelling in their own cities and possessions in Judah
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:3 and 11:20 show that many lived in their own cities and possessions, demonstrating trust in God's provision and contentment with what they had been given.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "The porters, Akkub, Talmon, and their brethren that kept the gates, were an hundred ______ and two."
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:19 states that the porters, Akkub, Talmon, and their brethren who kept the gates were 172, emphasizing faithful service in all roles.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11, what does the casting of lots for dwelling in Jerusalem teach about trusting God’s sovereign plan?
options: The people cast lots to determine who would live in Jerusalem, showing trust in God's guidance
Rulers forced people where to live without choice
There was no order in settling the city
questions.correctAnswer: The people cast lots to determine who would live in Jerusalem, showing trust in God's guidance
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:1 explains that the rest of the people cast lots to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem, demonstrating reliance on God’s sovereign direction amidst practical decisions.

hard.title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Nehemiah Chapter 11.

questions.question: What method was used to select the people who would dwell in Jerusalem according to Nehemiah 11?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:1 states that the rest of the people cast lots to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem.

questions.question: Who were counted among the inhabitants of Jerusalem besides the children of Judah and Benjamin?
options: Israel, priests, Levites, Nethinims, and children of Solomon's servants
Only the children of Judah and Benjamin
questions.correctAnswer: Israel, priests, Levites, Nethinims, and children of Solomon's servants
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:3 lists these groups as dwelling in Jerusalem and the cities of Judah.

questions.question: According to Nehemiah 11, who was the ruler of the house of God?
options: Zabdiel son of one of the great men
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:11 identifies Seraiah son of Hilkiah as the ruler of the house of God.

questions.question: Which group dwelt specifically in Ophel, and who were their overseers?
options: The Nethinims; overseen by Ziha and Gispa
The children of Judah; overseen by Maaseiah
questions.correctAnswer: The Nethinims; overseen by Ziha and Gispa
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:21 states that the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel and were overseen by Ziha and Gispa.

questions.question: What was the daily provision commanded by the king concerning the singers in the house of God?
options: A certain portion for the singers every day
Double portions on feast days only
Provision was given only during temple repairs
questions.correctAnswer: A certain portion for the singers every day
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:23 explains that the king commanded a daily portion for the singers.

questions.question: Who was the principal who began thanksgiving in prayer among the Levites?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:17 identifies Mattaniah son of Micha as the principal to begin thanksgiving in prayer.

questions.question: How many Levites were in the holy city according to Nehemiah 11?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:18 states that all the Levites in the holy city were two hundred fourscore and four (284).

questions.question: Which of the following cities was NOT mentioned as a dwelling place for the children of Judah?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:25-30 lists many cities but does not mention Jericho as a dwelling place of the children of Judah.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew term 'Nethinims' refer to, based on the cultural context of Nehemiah 11?
questions.explanation: The Nethinims, mentioned in Nehemiah 11:3 and 21, were temple servants dedicated to supporting Levitical duties, a term also seen in Ezra and Chronicles.

questions.question: Who served as the overseer of the Levites at Jerusalem?
options: Zabdiel son of a great man
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:22 states that Uzzi son of Bani was the overseer of the Levites at Jerusalem.

questions.question: Which family is identified as chief of the fathers with 242 brethren in Nehemiah 11?
options: The family of Adaiah son of Jeroham
The family of Amashai son of Azareel
The family of Jedaiah son of Joiarib
The family of Sallu son of Meshullam
questions.correctAnswer: The family of Adaiah son of Jeroham
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:12-13 states that Adaiah son of Jeroham and his brethren were chief of the fathers numbering 242.

questions.question: True or False: According to Nehemiah 11, all the priests and Levites lived exclusively in Jerusalem.
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:20 states that the residue of Israel, priests, and Levites were in all the cities of Judah, each in his inheritance, not only Jerusalem.

questions.question: What does the casting of lots in Nehemiah 11 symbolize in the broader biblical context?
options: Divine guidance and allocation of responsibilities
questions.correctAnswer: Divine guidance and allocation of responsibilities
questions.explanation: Casting lots, as in Nehemiah 11:1, was used throughout the Bible (e.g., Joshua 18:10) to discern God's will in decisions, indicating divine guidance.

questions.question: Which two individuals had oversight of the outward business of the house of God among the Levites?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:16 names Shabbethai and Jozabad as chief Levites overseeing the outward business of the house of God.

questions.question: How does Nehemiah 11 reflect the restoration theme found elsewhere in the Bible?
options: By resettling Jerusalem and organizing its inhabitants to restore worship and community
By establishing a new monarchy in Judah
By describing the construction of Solomon's temple
By recounting the Exodus from Egypt
questions.correctAnswer: By resettling Jerusalem and organizing its inhabitants to restore worship and community
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11 details the repopulation and organization of Jerusalem, paralleling themes of restoration seen in Isaiah and Ezra.

theological.title: Nehemiah Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Nehemiah Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What method was used to select the people who would dwell in Jerusalem according to Nehemiah 11?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:1 states that the rest of the people cast lots to bring one of ten to dwell in Jerusalem. This method reflects the biblical precedent of seeking God's guidance through casting lots (Proverbs 16:33, Acts 1:26).

questions.question: Who were blessed for willingly offering themselves to dwell in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: According to Nehemiah 11:2, all the men who willingly offered themselves to live in Jerusalem were blessed. This highlights the principle of willing service in God's work (2 Corinthians 9:7, Romans 12:1).

questions.question: Which groups are mentioned as dwelling in their possessions in the cities of Judah?
options: Israel, priests, Levites, Nethinims, children of Solomon's servants
questions.correctAnswer: Israel, priests, Levites, Nethinims, children of Solomon's servants
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:3 lists these groups as dwelling in their possessions in Judah, reflecting the restoration of tribal and priestly inheritance (Joshua 21:43-45, 1 Chronicles 6:54-81).

questions.question: Who was the overseer of the sons of Benjamin in Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:9 identifies Joel the son of Zichri as the overseer of the sons of Benjamin, illustrating the leadership structure in the restored community (Exodus 18:21, Numbers 1:5-16).

questions.question: Who was the ruler of the house of God among the priests at Jerusalem?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:11 states that Seraiah the son of Hilkiah was the ruler of the house of God. This office reflects the priestly leadership responsible for temple worship (1 Chronicles 6:13-15, Jeremiah 29:25).

questions.question: How many Levites dwelt in the holy city according to the chapter?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:18 records 284 Levites dwelling in the holy city, showing the continuation of the Levitical role in worship and service (Numbers 3:12-13, 1 Chronicles 23:3).

questions.question: Who had oversight of the outward business of the house of God among the Levites?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:16 identifies Shabbethai and Jozabad as having oversight of the outward business of the house of God, indicating the administrative roles given to Levites (1 Chronicles 26:20-21, Ezra 7:27).

questions.question: What role did Mattaniah the son of Micha have in the worship at Jerusalem?
options: Principal to begin thanksgiving in prayer
Ruler of the house of God
questions.correctAnswer: Principal to begin thanksgiving in prayer
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:17 shows Mattaniah as leading thanksgiving in prayer, a vital worship role pointing to the spiritual leadership of Levites (Psalm 100:4, Colossians 3:16).

questions.question: Where did the Nethinims dwell, and who was over them?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:21 states that the Nethinims dwelt in Ophel and that Ziha and Gispa were over them, reflecting the organized service roles assigned to temple assistants (1 Chronicles 9:2-3, Ezra 8:20).

questions.question: What was the king's commandment concerning the singers in the house of God?
options: A certain portion should be due for them every day
They should serve only on the Sabbath
They were exempt from all other duties
They must only sing during festivals
questions.correctAnswer: A certain portion should be due for them every day
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:23 records the king’s command that a certain portion be given to singers daily, showing royal provision for temple worship (1 Chronicles 9:33, 2 Chronicles 29:25-30).

questions.question: Who was at the king's hand in all matters concerning the people?
options: Zabdiel the son of a great man
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:24 states Pethahiah was at the king’s hand in all matters concerning the people, indicating trusted royal administration (Nehemiah 2:7-8, Esther 4:13-14).

questions.question: Which territories did the children of Judah inhabit outside Jerusalem?
options: Kirjatharba, Dibon, Jekabzeel, Jeshua, Moladah, Bethphelet, Beersheba, and others
Only Jerusalem and its immediate villages
questions.correctAnswer: Kirjatharba, Dibon, Jekabzeel, Jeshua, Moladah, Bethphelet, Beersheba, and others
questions.explanation: Verses 25-30 list these cities as inhabited by Judah’s children, showing the distribution of tribes in their allotted lands (Joshua 15:20-62, Numbers 34:3-5).

questions.question: From which city did the children of Benjamin come to dwell in Michmash, Aija, and Bethel?
questions.explanation: Nehemiah 11:31 states that the children of Benjamin from Geba dwelt in Michmash, Aija, and Bethel, reflecting tribal settlements and heritage (Joshua 18:24-28, Judges 20:18).

questions.question: What is the significance of the orderly dwelling of priests, Levites, and people in Jerusalem and other cities?
options: It reflects the fulfillment of God's covenant promises and proper worship restoration
It shows political independence from the king
It indicates the abandonment of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects the fulfillment of God's covenant promises and proper worship restoration
questions.explanation: The organization described in Nehemiah 11 aligns with God's covenantal restoration promises (Leviticus 26:11-12, Jeremiah 30:18), emphasizing the reestablishment of worship and community under God’s rule (Acts 15:16-17).

questions.question: How do the roles of Levites and priests in Nehemiah 11 contribute to our understanding of ecclesiology?
options: They demonstrate the ordered ministry and spiritual leadership within God's covenant community
They show that all roles are equal with no distinction
They focus only on secular governance
They indicate a temporary system abolished in the New Testament
questions.correctAnswer: They demonstrate the ordered ministry and spiritual leadership within God's covenant community
questions.explanation: The detailed roles of Levites and priests in Nehemiah 11 reflect God's design for worship and governance in His people (1 Timothy 3:15, Hebrews 7:11-28), pointing to Christ as the ultimate high priest (Hebrews 4:14).
